alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued May 05 at 2:19PM EDT until May 06 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Walton, Bay, and Gulf County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A thunderstorm complex offshore has increased surf heights this afternoon, which has led to an increase in rip currents across the Florida Panhandle beaches. Beach goers should take caution when heading into the water this afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; South Walton
